titlestmt.titleproper: Finding aid for the U.S. restitution of Nazi-looted cultural treasures to the USSR, 1945-1959 [electronic resource] : facsimile documents from the National Archives of the United States / compiled with an introduction by Patricia Kennedy Grimsted.

profiledesc.creation: Encoded finding aid created from MARC record by Dallas Pillen
profiledesc.langusage: The finding aid is written in English

did.unittitle: U.S. restitution of Nazi-looted cultural treasures to the USSR, 1945-1959 [electronic resource] : facsimile documents from the National Archives of the United States / compiled with an introduction by Patricia Kennedy Grimsted.

odd.head: Publication, Distribution, Etc.
odd.p: Washington, D.C. : National Archives and Records Administration, 2001.

odd.head: Formatted Contents Note
odd.p: Foreword / Michael J. Kurtz -- Documenting U.S. cultural restitution to the USSR, 1945-1959 / Patricia Kennedy Grimsted -- Facsimile documents -- Nineteen U.S. restitution transfers to the USSR -- Related documents.

odd.head: General Note
odd.p: "Prepared in collaboration with the National Archives of the United States"--Introductory screen.

archdesc.scopecontent: A compilation of documents establishing the transfer of art works, archives, and other cultural artifacts seized by the Nazis during World War II and returned by the United States to the Soviet Union in the years 1945-1959. Also included are black and white photographs and a discussion of the issues of American restitution of cultural artifacts and the demands of other European countries for the restitution of cultural artifacts from the Russian Federation which had been held by the Soviet Union.

subject.term: Documenting U.S. cultural restitution to the USSR, 1945-1959.
